attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Insurance companies are always ready to take our money - but resist paying out claims. Of course they need to be diligent for the good of the shareholders and the policyholders.
But statistics such as:
percentage of claims paid, number of claims rejected, speed of claim settlement etc. should be published.
This would enable citizens to make informed decisions beyond "who is the cheapest".
Insurance companies who do not respond to claims fairly are a burden on society.
Insurance companies should be proud of their performance statistics - why is this information secret?
